org.ljtoolkit.params
Class TransformEventParams

java.lang.Object
  org.ljtoolkit.params.BaseParams
      org.ljtoolkit.params.BaseEventParams
          org.ljtoolkit.params.TransformEventParams

public class TransformEventParams
extends BaseEventParams

This class represents the parameter object used to post an event to Live Journal. The way in which the values are set in the class will determine the characteristics of the post.

Author:
Troy Bourdon

getEvent

public java.lang.String getEvent()
The event text the user is submitting, may be a revision if this is an edit post event.

Returns:
event

setEvent

public void setEvent(java.lang.String event)
If this is an original post this will be the text of the post. If this is a revision/update this will be the revised text. If this is a delete this should be null. Carriage returns are okay (0x0A, 0x0A0D, or 0x0D0A), although 0x0D are removed internally to make everything into Unix-style line-endings (just \ns). Posts may also contain HTML, but be aware that the LiveJournal server converts newlines to HTML
s when displaying them, so your client should not try to insert these itself.

Parameters:
event -

getSubject

public java.lang.String getSubject()
Get the subject of this post

Returns:
subject

setSubject

public void setSubject(java.lang.String subject)
The subject for this post. Limited to 255 characters. No newlines.

Parameters:
subject -

getSecurity

public EventSecurity getSecurity()
Get the EventSecurity for this post.

Returns:
security

setSecurity

public void setSecurity(EventSecurity security)
(Optional) Specifies who can read this post. Valid values are public (default), private and usemask. When value is usemask, viewability is controlled by the allowmask.

Parameters:
security -

getAllowmask

public java.util.BitSet getAllowmask()
Get the allowmask for this post

Returns:
allowmask

setAllowmask

public void setAllowmask(java.util.BitSet allowmask)
Relevant when security is usemask. A 32-bit unsigned integer representing which of the user's groups of friends are allowed to view this post. Turn bit 0 on to allow any defined friend to read it. Otherwise, turn bit 1-30 on for every friend group that should be allowed to read it. Bit 31 is reserved.

Parameters:
allowmask -
